SettingsItem.Name: Sampling method
SettingsItem.Description: The sampling method that should be included in the action.

SettingsItem.Name: Censored values handling method (also used as fallback for censored lognormal approach)
SettingsItem.Description: Method for dealing with censored value samples in human monitoring data. Note that this method is also used as a fallback when fitting a censored lognormal model to the concentration data fails.

SettingsItem.Name: Fraction for censored value replacement
SettingsItem.Description: Factor used for replacing the censored value.

SettingsItem.Name: Missing value imputation method
SettingsItem.Description: Imputation method for missing values: 1) By zero, 2) Impute from data, 3) No missing value imputation

SettingsItem.Name: Imputation method for non detect values
SettingsItem.Description: Imputation method for non detect values: replace nondetects based on by f*LOD/LOQ) or from left tail censored lognormal distribution.

SettingsItem.Name: Apply kinetic conversions​
SettingsItem.Description: Convert substance concentrations from other biological matrices using kinetic conversion models. The substances for conversion are designated within the kinetic models module. Substance conversion proves valuable when a biomarker was not directly measured for a matrix of interest.

SettingsItem.Name: Convert to single exposure surface (biological matrix or external route)​
SettingsItem.Description: Convert all substance concentrations from other biological matrices to the same target biological matrix. This conversion is applied when the number of substances measured on the target biological matrix is limited. Substances measured on other matrices can be converted using kinetic conversion models.

SettingsItem.Name: Exposure surface level (external or internal)
SettingsItem.Description: The targeted exposure surface level of the HBM analysis.

SettingsItem.Name: Specify the minimum percentage of non-missing values (%)
SettingsItem.Description: Specify the minimum percentage of non-missing values required for imputation. No imputation is done when the percentage of non-missing values in the data is smaller than the specified percentage.

SettingsItem.Name: Standardise blood concentrations for lipid-soluble substances
SettingsItem.Description: Standardise blood concentrations for lipid-soluble substances: 1) Standardise by total lipid measured via gravimetric analysis, 2) Standardise by total lipid measured via enzymatic summation, 3) Standardise by derived total lipid content of Triglycerides/Cholesterol (Bernert et al. 2007).

SettingsItem.Name: Specify the standardisation method of blood concentrations for lipid-soluble substances
SettingsItem.Description: Specify the standardisation method of blood concentrations for lipid-soluble substances.

SettingsItem.Name: Subset selection: exclude substances from lipid standardisation
SettingsItem.Description: Select this option to exclude one or more lipid-soluble substances from standardisation.

SettingsItem.Name: Select substances to exclude from lipid standardisation
SettingsItem.Description: The selected (lipid-soluble) substances will be excluded from lipid standardisation.

SettingsItem.Name: Normalise or standardise urine concentrations for specific gravity or creatinine
SettingsItem.Description: Normalise or standardise urine concentrations for specific gravity or creatinine: 1) Normalise by specific gravity, 2) Standardise by creatinine concentration.

SettingsItem.Name: Specify the normalisation/standardisation method of urine concentrations for specific gravity or creatinine
SettingsItem.Description: Specify the normalisation/standardisation method of urine concentrations for specific gravity or creatinine.

SettingsItem.Name: Subset selection: exclude substances from urine normalisation/standardisation
SettingsItem.Description: Select this option to exclude one or more substances from normalization for specific gravity or creatinine standardisation.

SettingsItem.Name: Select the substances to exclude from urine normalisation/standardisation
SettingsItem.Description: The selected substances will be excluded from urine normalization/standardisation.

SettingsItem.Name: Use complete analysed samples
SettingsItem.Description: Select this option to remove samples from individuals for which one or more of the selected substances have not been analysed.

SettingsItem.Name: Exclude substances from sampling method
SettingsItem.Description: Select this option to exclude one or more substances from the selected sampling methods.

SettingsItem.Name: Substances to exclude from a sampling method
SettingsItem.Description: The data of the selected substances will be excluded from analysis.

SettingsItem.Name: Apply exposure biomarker conversions
SettingsItem.Description: Use this option to translate HBM concentrations derived from measured substances (biomarkers) to concentrations of other substances. This can be usefull when the measured substance is a combination of multiple substances, e.g., to translate measured total arsenic (t-As) to toxicologically relevant arsenic (TRA). This option can also be used to translate between different expression types (e.g., from measured urine concentration to urine concentrations standardized for specific gravity), but not for translation between different biological matrices.

SettingsItem.Name: Specific gravity conversion factor
SettingsItem.Description: A specific gravity adjustment is applied by multiplying a creatinine adjusted concentration with a factor (default 1.48 for adults 18 - 68 year).

SettingsItem.Name: Filter on repeated measurements
SettingsItem.Description: Select this option to make a selection of the time points to be included in the action. By default, all time points are included.

SettingsItem.Name: Selected measurements
SettingsItem.Description: The measurements that should be included in the action.
